channel.title: Hammer shouldn't count as running Black Mesa
channel.description:
Currently, if you run Black Mesa's hammer.exe, Steam thinks you are running Black Mesa. Other than racking up many hours "playing" Black Mesa, this also makes it so you can't launch Black Mesa from Steam. A workaround is to launch bms.exe itself (thanks, Daz :wink: ).
It would be nice if running Hammer didn't count as running Black Mesa so it would be easier to manage and one less obstacle for newbie mappers. :thumbsup:

item.title: Hammer shouldn't count as running Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
I’d like to bump this thread to state that this issue is still happening two years later. I don’t know if this problem is due to the code of the BM build of Hammer or an issue with the Steamworks API integration, but it’s really annoying to crack open Hammer for a few minutes, close it, and then come back to your computer later to realize that Steam has been counting you as ingame this whole time and you have to kill the process to play anything (including Black Mesa!)
